document.title: Health Education Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools

E24DF7B7C2D04686BF292D538D4B0CA8.description: Demonstrate ways to conserve and promote the conservation of natural resources.

559FA6D5430C496BAB14D536F4F195A2.description:
Create strategies to promote awareness of consequences associated with gang
involvement and healthy alternatives to gang involvement.

09DC58F626C44F47B0DFBD31930D0FF0.description: Create a campaign to prevent/stop bullying or cyberbullying.

B353F068927241A88793B52B53A5769D.description:
Assess your school’s safety protocols (e.g., reporting processes, support provided for a
positive climate) and recommend suggestions for improvement.

E7D19E47297247FAB43211AFCF73FF64.description:
Identify personal, family, school, community, and healthcare professional resources
that can help oneself and others with mental illnesses and challenges.

2240EB3895B64ED688EF4752F011B27A.description: Identify school and community resources for help and support with eating disorders.

4BFAE26D58314B3782F9D0F35F59FCB5.description: Demonstrate healthy verbal, nonverbal, written, and visual communication skills.

6118B5F39D7541B48CB725EA60C8E273.description: Promote help-seeking for mental health concerns.

CD140CE20F584E31A66B98308D866746.description: Promote strategies for coping with disappointment and adversity.

A3CB0E6233FD436B8BD3604613F73287.description:
Design ways to demonstrate empathy, compassion, and acceptance for others to support
healthy relationships.

35C46BC4AC334BECAFC9FACF25E02A36.description: Develop achievable goals for handling stressors in healthy ways.

FED5ED37A7CB4667804429B23EEADBFF.description:
Describe ways to maintain a safe and healthy environment at school, in the community,
at home, and online.

ABD1016A23DD4314921138FC5AD88A6E.description:
Identify and demonstrate strategies and skills for avoiding alcohol, tobacco, inhalants,
and other harmful substances (e.g., effective refusal skills).

451CD00F8C3E470F9B8C35ABEC34EBE7.description:
Create strategies to identify types of advertising techniques used in a variety of media,
including social media that may influence adolescents’ decisions concerning alcohol,
tobacco and nicotine products, and other drugs.

42410195279F4776B149E0960F19BEB3.description:
Identify ways to participate in school and community efforts to promote a drug-free
lifestyle.

04269A3CD2AA45438E20608B97A27A56.description:
Evaluate and promote a healthcare product or service for students, families, schools, or
communities that will help others to make positive health choices.

9FB581773DA349DE997125066CE36634.description:
Define public health, and describe the associated health and medical careers and the
training required for these occupations.

951B3FE5B05B4C948A7773F9B1993067.description: Determine strategies to protect against the harmful effects of the sun, heat, and cold.

FD933A33513043FFAE3E979CC4EB0C48.description:
Engage family to create a personal plan to meet recommended guidelines for sleep and
rest.

BB7A759B238A4787BDE997761CB4AA59.description:
Design and promote safe walking and bike routes to and from school or another
location in the community.

B3DB3A023A4B461CBBC9B1DEDEB9EBBF.description:
Promote understanding of the importance of handwashing, not sharing food, and
allergen safe-zones.

B003A8EE7BF842BEBA5A2D21D4AB4CEF.description:
Explore opportunities to engage with local school wellness policy committees to
advocate for nutritional food and beverage choices for all school-sponsored events.

244DAB67E3054919898BC02BBFFF01A2.description:
Educate peers and family members on the importance of eating a healthy breakfast and
being physically active.

11E46EBC709B42D8B449F8201BBB6FC9.description: Encourage nutrient-dense food choices at home, at school, and in restaurants.

BEBD065AD9114C46A2937F0BBC693A95.description: Promote strategies for maintaining a healthy circulatory system.

A10F9C4FCA7640699EEFD4FFEEBBE9D1.description: The student will promote healthy schools, families, and communities.

2F7B39BC354843AF832F7BEDED449BE9.description: Explain how environmental health is essential to personal and community health.

10AA2A5D9C4545B3BCE7C4D629FC3D50.description:
Explain why people may join gangs, including the relationship between self-image and
gang-related behaviors.

3299AA6684A64A1FB38BE06A9C9668A9.description:
Explain why it is important to be able to identify bullying behavior to prevent bullying
and cyberbullying.

CAD636D9693E49EBBFE297CED9D08773.description:
Explain how violence, bullying, and harassment affect personal health and school
safety.

1284DE896D5F456DAD08F4650E276613.description:
Explain when mental illnesses and mental challenges require support or assistance (e.g.,
when they affect one’s relationships, responsibilities, and involvement in activities).

6BF8102834754AEBB62D39361429DAC7.description: Describe the warning signs, risk factors, and protective factors for eating disorders.

C88D574635194C3E83488498B164D588.description:
Describe the relationship between healthy communication skills and healthy
relationships.

EA25467E94874B31B5D302DC0B4D429A.description:
Develop healthy ways to identify, express, and respond to emotions and identify
resources for help and support.

B0CDECF79234446290FEF7363D9B0D87.description: Develop strategies for coping with disappointment, stress, anxiety, anger, and adversity.

C1D67F3129CE4528A216084A911A3754.description:
Explain how empathy, compassion, and acceptance of others support healthy
relationships.

08E8E1842DB44C00B181BABD5EC5D7D0.description:
Analyze and explain the benefits of emotional flexibility, stress management, and
stress-reduction techniques for physical and emotional health.

97CAB4E184E648DCA275BE48B566FBF7.description:
Explain the importance of recognizing harmful and risky behaviors related to personal
safety.

4E7101E3778F4D3CA7A6C48AF7C23612.description:
Identify short term, social and negative consequences of engaging in risky behaviors,
including the use of alcohol, tobacco, nicotine products, marijuana, and other drugs.

00B91D8119FE4E8BA542BBDC2EC7E57A.description:
Explain the purpose of the Food and Drug Administration (FDA), and differentiate
between FDA-approved and non-FDA-approved substances.

007F6B7A6931485D896A97242BDBDDA6.description: Understand that addiction is a compulsive physiological need for and use of a habitforming substance.

339601BC7F174C1BAFF0B0D9F3D6E7A5.description: Identify state and federal laws that provide consumer protections.

16B796953A9B4C518F4D388AB79C3F2D.description: Identify resources in the community that are dedicated to promoting health.

96060DF40D9D4D089EEDE29CFDEA37F3.description:
Describe ways to prevent weather- or climate-related physical environmental
conditions, such as allergies, asthma, sunburn, dehydration, heatstroke, heat exhaustion,
and hypothermia.

3EF3BAB88D334909BF1C9978F66DC056.description:
Compare current personal sleep and rest habits with recommended guidelines for
teenagers.

25A14987BB0143708E07ADDE9453BAA8.description: Analyze the physical and mental health benefits of active transportation.

C825370BC5404AE1B48DDA82C8407AA5.description: Discuss the concept of an allergen-safe zone.

DB746A05FFBF4E1C907DCC33F4C5F639.description:
Use a decision-making process to evaluate daily food intake and nutritional
requirements.

1CD8FF44174243B6A12ED97C1C548413.description: Explain the cognitive and physical benefits of eating a healthy breakfast.

4D713C7A161643629511FDFD1CC57541.description: Analyze the effects of nutrition on daily performance (i.e., mind and body).

5B7EAD5EA76A4779BAEA812DF9D68DF4.description:
Describe how healthy food choices and physical activity keep the circulatory system
healthy.

E72FF49119C542C680171B2B1B8E3D07.description: The student will use decision-making skills to promote health and personal wellness.

5515FA25B6554AC3890404418B068D9F.description: Describe human behaviors that contribute to air, water, soil, and noise pollution.

CB8B58F699504E88B76DF9A9AE575BE0.description: Explain the myths and facts about gangs and gang-related behaviors.

87DE79B7A58A4A2893F1FE51655DA6E4.description: Describe the role of empathy in preventing bullying and cyberbullying.

7DA7E90E1BEE431796EC03948C0D82CA.description:
List the characteristics of and how to contribute to a positive (i.e., emotionally safe)
school climate.

672AEB3CD4E14411822A7EA1370DC6D8.description:
Define depression and describe the warning signs, risk factors, and protective factors
for anxiety and depression.

719FBD17C5604DB7A2890393067FA0F9.description: Define disordered eating and describe types of eating disorders.

A85480FFA62F4A8699DFA3181824218C.description: Identify healthy verbal, nonverbal, written, and visual communication.

50D505FB9E3B4502A44084880ACD6FE5.description:
Describe situations that can cause a range of emotions and feelings, and describe how
to recognize these feelings and emotions and predict how long they may last.

F91370153F2A4AB4B22306C870E3F230.description:
Recognize the impact of disappointment or adversity on physical, social, and emotional
health and how to cope effectively and change one’s feelings.

32A1ABF1A0404EA399CAAA0D9ECD3E53.description: Identify the characteristics of healthy interpersonal relationships.

1F26E6C27EDF42C5B6600124FC2C2D2E.description: Identify the body’s physical and psychological responses to stress.

3BBC84E9B83E4ADDA544F0474033D744.description:
Identify potential safety issues related to babysitting, caring for younger siblings, being
alone at home, in the neighborhood (e.g., water sports, recreation areas, shopping
areas), and being online.

DD4092D5EFE64994BF2A22BE25130972.description:
Identify the types of behavior associated with drug use and abuse that reflect positive
norms (e.g., drug use is not cool, drunken driving is stupid, most teens do not use
drugs).

F3843F5535B04B388F65436271CFB042.description:
Define prescriptions, controlled substances, nicotine vaping products, hemp, and
marijuana-derived cannabidiol (CBD) products, and explain their uses.

8F1B866104A94D78B68BE0E681EC6528.description:
Explain the link between addiction to alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs; chronic
disease; and engaging in risky behaviors.

EC6C8F1A24A3487CA3412B4838358E20.description:
Identify government agencies that provide consumer protections for health products
and services.

4A5DAE809E1A46B8BCA32377A14E5B17.description:
Describe how the school and the community can impact personal health practices and
behaviors, including the availability of physical, emotional, and social health services;
emergency response systems; healthcare products; and recreational and leisure
opportunities.

D1B2D298CDEA46E89C462F7E39DAFA4D.description:
Explain the impact of weather- or climate-related physical conditions on individuals,
including allergies, asthma, sunburn, dehydration, heatstroke, heat exhaustion, and
hypothermia.

35CBD6DA34134C93B6A2FEA756B48E73.description:
Evaluate the impact of sleep and rest on physical, social, and emotional health and on
cognitive performance.

CA6BD475780F4772990D2E7B6DBA4EAD.description: Explain the concept of active transportation (e.g., walking, biking).

9E246F7AA3694E48B69ED06DBDC1B0AB.description: Explain how allergens cause an allergic reaction.

C2182359C32A4D4BA2BCA69F2218EA70.description: Identify decision-making steps for selecting healthy foods and beverages.

073DAE78CF37492A92CEB2B34E80C369.description:
Describe the benefit of eating foods to meet recommendations for iron, calcium,
potassium, vitamin D, and dietary fiber.

F4CA82E4BBFD43B09E3C6B71A29EAFBF.description: Describe the value of nutrient-dense foods.

1AF90433A6C643E58B6FA1DF4DD92C33.description: Identify and describe the major structures and functions of the circulatory system.

24A45764066E43F8A703897488EA2FCB.description:
The student will identify and explain essential health concepts to understand personal
health.
